page.title: Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Hosni Mubarak's rule

rev.comment: /* 1 February â March of the Millions */ fixed
rev.diff:
Line 118: Line 118:
[[File:Millionmarchtahrirsquare.jpg|thumb|Tahrir Square during the March of the Millions]]
[[File:Millionmarchtahrirsquare.jpg|thumb|Tahrir Square during the March of the Millions]]
â
Opposition leaders called for a million-strong march dubbed '''"March of the Millions"'''<ref>{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=article in german. at minimum, needs english translation of headline appended to "trans_title" field}} {{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/multimedia/bilder/kairo206.html |title=Marsch der Millionen: In Kairo marschieren die Massen gegen Mubarak|work=[[Tagesschau (Germany)|Tagesschau]]|trans_title=|language=[[German language|German]] |date= |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> (literally the "March of One Million", from the Arabic {{lang|ar|ÙØ³ÙØ±Ø© ÙÙÙÙÙ}} ''masÄ«rat milyÅn'') from Cairo's Tahrir Square to the [[Heliopolis Palace|Presidential Palace]] in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]] on 1 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2011/01/31/3126194.htm|title=Egypt Protesters Call for Million-Man March|publisher=Abc.net.au|date=|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title='Mega Protest' Planned in Egypt|work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=31 January 2011|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/01/20111316148317175.html|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Egyptian security forces fortified Mubarak's presidential palace with coils of barbed wire to ensure that the protesters can not get there.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2011/0202/1224288768049.html|title=West Has Little To Fear from Arab Populism|author=Staunton, Denis|date=2 February 2011|work=[[The Irish Times]] |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref>
+
Opposition leaders called for a million-strong march dubbed '''"March of the Millions"'''<ref>http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2011/01/31/world/main7301297.shtml</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/multimedia/bilder/kairo206.html |title=Marsch der Millionen: In Kairo marschieren die Massen gegen Mubarak|work=[[Tagesschau (Germany)|Tagesschau]]|trans_title=|language=[[German language|German]] |date= |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref> (literally the "March of One Million", from the Arabic {{lang|ar|ÙØ³ÙØ±Ø© ÙÙÙÙÙÙØ©}}<ref>http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/1BCBED22-E192-4A34-BED1-1C7146436175.htm</ref> ''masÄ«rat milyÅna'') from Cairo's Tahrir Square to the [[Heliopolis Palace|Presidential Palace]] in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]] on 1 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2011/01/31/3126194.htm|title=Egypt Protesters Call for Million-Man March|publisher=Abc.net.au|date=|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|title='Mega Protest' Planned in Egypt|work=[[Al Jazeera English]]|date=31 January 2011|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/01/20111316148317175.html|accessdate=31 January 2011}}</ref> Egyptian security forces fortified Mubarak's presidential palace with coils of barbed wire to ensure that the protesters can not get there.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2011/0202/1224288768049.html|title=West Has Little To Fear from Arab Populism|author=Staunton, Denis|date=2 February 2011|work=[[The Irish Times]] |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref>
According to the Egyptian government media, the number of the protesters in Cairo numbered in the thousands. The BBC reported the number of protesters in Tahrir Square ranged from "more than 100,000 to some 250,000 â the square's maximum capacity."<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 "Live Update at 15:44: Huge Protests Fan Egypt Unrest"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 1 February 2011.</ref> Egyptian security forces stated that 500,000 people participated in the protests in Cairo alone.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/aegyptenprotest120.html |title=Ãgypten: Mubarak verzichtet auf weitere Amtszeit |language={{de icon}} |publisher=tagesschau.de |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> According to ''Al Jazeera'', over one million protesters gathered in central Cairo by the afternoon, a number growing to around 2 million later in the day.<ref>{{Cite news|work=[[Ynetnews]]|last=Shezaf|first=Tsur|title=A Million People Protest in Egypt|date=1 February 2011|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4022504,00.html|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
According to the Egyptian government media, the number of the protesters in Cairo numbered in the thousands. The BBC reported the number of protesters in Tahrir Square ranged from "more than 100,000 to some 250,000 â the square's maximum capacity."<ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 "Live Update at 15:44: Huge Protests Fan Egypt Unrest"]. ''[[BBC News]]''. 1 February 2011.</ref> Egyptian security forces stated that 500,000 people participated in the protests in Cairo alone.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tagesschau.de/ausland/aegyptenprotest120.html |title=Ãgypten: Mubarak verzichtet auf weitere Amtszeit |language={{de icon}} |publisher=tagesschau.de |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> According to ''Al Jazeera'', over one million protesters gathered in central Cairo by the afternoon, a number growing to around 2 million later in the day.<ref>{{Cite news|work=[[Ynetnews]]|last=Shezaf|first=Tsur|title=A Million People Protest in Egypt|date=1 February 2011|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4022504,00.html|accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
